options.a: A technique used to train computers to learn from their mistakes.
options.b: A branch of computer science that focuses on mimicking the human brain.
options.c: A method for creating self-driving cars.
options.d: A type of software that can detect cancer cells.

questions.question: 2. What is one of the most notable recent applications of deep learning?

options.a: Creating a new type of battery.

questions.question: 3. What is NOT true about deep learning?

options.a: It has been used in Customer Support.
options.b: It is a new technology developed in the last few years.
options.c: It has applications in medical care.
options.d: It is a branch of computer science.

questions.question: 4. What is the main goal of deep learning?

options.a: To train machines to learn from data.
options.b: To replace human workers with machines.
options.c: To create artificial intelligence that is superior to human intelligence.
options.d: To understand how the human brain works.

questions.question: 5. How does deep learning differ from traditional machine learning?

options.a: It uses less data to train models.
options.b: It requires more human input to function.
options.c: It uses artificial neural networks with multiple layers.
options.d: It is only applicable to specific tasks.

questions.question: 6. How is deep learning used in medical care?

options.c: To analyze medical images and diagnose diseases.
options.d: To provide medical advice to patients.

questions.question: 7. What is the relationship between deep learning and the human brain?

options.a: Deep learning is a direct replica of the human brain.
options.b: Deep learning uses artificial neural networks inspired by the human brain.
options.c: The human brain is used to develop deep learning algorithms.
options.d: Deep learning is an attempt to understand how the human brain works.

questions.question: 8. What is the significance of Sergey Brin's death in relation to deep learning?

options.a: It is a reminder of the risks associated with artificial intelligence.
options.b: It is a major setback for the development of deep learning.
options.c: It has no direct connection to the field of deep learning.
options.d: It highlights the importance of ethical considerations in AI development.

questions.question: 9. Which of the following is NOT an application of deep learning mentioned in the summary?
10. What is the main focus of the BBC article?

options.c: The impact of deep learning on society.
options.d: The latest developments in deep learning technology.
